name: Vakratunda Mahakaya
sanskrit: vakratuṇḍa mahākāya sūryakoṭi samaprabha nirvighnaṃ kuru me deva sarvakāryeṣu sarvadā
meaning: O Lord with curved trunk and huge body, whose brilliance equals a million suns, please remove all obstacles from my endeavors, always.

deepMeaning.symbolism: The curved trunk represents the cosmic sound 'Om' and wisdom to navigate complex situations
deepMeaning.blessing: Removal of obstacles and success in all endeavors
deepMeaning.benefit: Students gain sharper memory and concentration for academic success

trivia: Very popular in Maharashtra during Ganesh Chaturthi

name: Guru Brahma
sanskrit: gururbrahmā gururviṣṇuḥ gururdevo maheśvaraḥ guruḥ sākṣāt parabrahma tasmai śrī gurave namaḥ
meaning: Guru is Brahma (creator), Guru is Vishnu (preserver), Guru is Shiva (destroyer). Guru is the supreme reality itself. Salutations to that Guru.

deepMeaning.symbolism: Guru creates knowledge, preserves it, and destroys ignorance - like the three main gods
deepMeaning.etymology: 'Gu' means darkness, 'Ru' means remover - Guru removes darkness of ignorance
deepMeaning.blessing: Liberation from ignorance and the cycle of rebirth

trivia: Recited on Teacher's Day and Guru Purnima

name: Karagre Vasate
sanskrit: karāgre vasate lakṣmiḥ karamadhye sarasvati karamūle tu govindaḥ prabhāte karadarśanam
meaning: At the tip of the fingers resides Lakshmi, in the middle of the palm resides Saraswati, at the base of the palm resides Govinda. Look at your palms in the morning.

deepMeaning.symbolism: Our hands carry divine energies - wealth, wisdom, and protection through our actions
deepMeaning.lesson: Achievement comes through our own hands and honest actions
deepMeaning.practice: Look at palms, visualize the three deities, rub palms, touch eyes

trivia: Also called 'Karadarshanam' - looking at hands

name: Samudra Vasane
sanskrit: samudravasane devi parvatastanamaṇḍale viṣṇupatni namastubhyaṃ pādasparśaṃ kṣamasvame
meaning: O Goddess dressed in oceans, with mountains as your bosom, wife of Vishnu, I bow to you. Please forgive me for stepping on you.

deepMeaning.symbolism: Earth wears oceans as clothes and mountains as ornaments - a beautiful poetic image
deepMeaning.blessing: Forgiveness for walking on Mother Earth
deepMeaning.environmentalMessage: Teaches respect for nature and environmental awareness
deepMeaning.humility: Starting the day with humility and gratitude

trivia: Also called Bhumi Vandana or Kshama Prarthana (forgiveness prayer)

name: Ganga Shloka
sanskrit: gaṅge ca yamune caiva godāvari sarasvati narmade sindhu kāveri jale'smin saṃnidhiṃ kuru
meaning: O Ganga, Yamuna, Godavari, Saraswati, Narmada, Sindhu, and Kaveri - please be present in this water.

deepMeaning.symbolism: Invokes the purity and blessings of all seven sacred rivers into everyday water
deepMeaning.blessing: Transforms ordinary water into sacred tirtha (holy water)
deepMeaning.gratitude: Expression of gratitude to God for the gift of water

trivia: These are the Sapta Sindhus - seven sacred rivers of India

name: Shubham Karoti
sanskrit: śubhaṃ karoti kalyāṇam ārogyaṃ dhanasaṃpadā śatrubuddhi vināśāya dīpajyoti namo'stute
meaning: The lamp brings auspiciousness, welfare, health, and wealth. It destroys enemy-like thoughts. Salutations to the lamp light.

deepMeaning.symbolism: Light represents knowledge dispelling the darkness of ignorance
deepMeaning.innerMeaning: Destroys negative thoughts (inner enemies), not external enemies

trivia: Recited during Deepavali and daily lamp lighting

name: Annapurna Shloka
sanskrit: annapūrṇe sadāpūrṇe śankara prāṇavallabhe jñāna vairāgya sidhyarthaṃ bhikṣāṃ dehicha pārvati
meaning: O Annapurna, ever complete, beloved of Shankara, give me alms for attaining knowledge and detachment, O Parvati.

deepMeaning.symbolism: Annapurna means 'full of food' - the goddess who provides nourishment
deepMeaning.request: Asks for knowledge (jnana) and detachment (vairagya), not just food
deepMeaning.relationship: Shiva once begged food from Annapurna to teach that even gods depend on food

trivia: Annapurna temple in Varanasi is very famous

name: Aham Vaishvanaro
sanskrit: ahaṃ vaiśvānaro bhūtvā prāṇināṃ dehamāśritaḥ prāṇāpāna samāyuktaḥ pacāmyannaṃ caturvidham
meaning: I become the digestive fire in living beings, and united with prana and apana, I digest the four kinds of food.

deepMeaning.symbolism: God is present as the fire that digests our food - He is within us
deepMeaning.pranaApana: Two vital airs that help digestion
deepMeaning.lesson: Eating is a sacred act - God helps us digest food

trivia: From Chapter 15 of Bhagavad Gita

name: Brahmarpanam
sanskrit: brahmārpaṇaṃ brahma haviḥ brahmāgnau brahmaṇā hutam brahmaiva tena gaṃtavyaṃ brahmakarma samādhinā
meaning: The offering is Brahman, the oblation is Brahman, offered by Brahman into the fire of Brahman. Brahman shall be reached by one who sees Brahman in all actions.

deepMeaning.symbolism: Everything in the act of eating is Brahman - the food, the eater, the eating, the digestion
deepMeaning.philosophy: When we see the divine in all actions, we attain liberation
deepMeaning.lesson: Transforms the mundane act of eating into a sacred offering
deepMeaning.depth: One of the most philosophical shlokas - everything is Brahman

trivia: From Chapter 4 of Bhagavad Gita - Jnana Yoga

name: Rama Skandham
sanskrit: rāmaṃ skandhaṃ hanumantaṃ vainateyaṃ vṛkodaraṃ śayane yaḥ smare nityam dusvapna stasyanaśyati
meaning: One who remembers Rama, Skanda, Hanuman, Garuda (Vinateya), and Bhima (Vrikodara) while going to sleep, their bad dreams are destroyed.

fiveProtectors.Rama: The ideal king and avatar of Vishnu
fiveProtectors.Skanda: Son of Shiva, god of war (Kartikeya/Murugan)
fiveProtectors.Hanuman: The devoted servant, symbol of strength
fiveProtectors.Vinateya: Garuda - the divine eagle, Vishnu's vehicle

deepMeaning.blessing: Protection from nightmares and peaceful sleep
deepMeaning.commonTheme: All five are known for their strength and ability to defeat evil

trivia: Vrikodara means 'wolf-bellied' - Bhima's name due to his huge appetite

name: Shanti Mantra (Sahana Vavatu)
sanskrit: Om Sahana vavatu Saha Nau Bhunaktu Saha Viiryam Karavaavahai Tejasvi Naava dhiitamastu Maa Vidvi shavahai Om Shaantih Shaantih Shaantih
meaning: May we be protected together, may we be nourished together, may we work together with vigor, may our study be brilliant, may we not quarrel. Om Peace, Peace, Peace.

deepMeaning.relationship: Emphasizes the sacred bond between teacher (Guru) and student (Shishya)

tripleShanti.third: Connects the soul to higher self

deepMeaning.lesson: Learning happens best in harmony and cooperation

trivia: Often chanted at the start of yoga classes

name: Devi Shloka (Sarvamangala)
sanskrit: Om sarvamangala maangalye shive sarvaartha saadhike Sharanye tryambike gowri naaraayani namostute
meaning: O auspicious one who bestows auspiciousness, O Shive who fulfills all purposes, O refuge, three-eyed Gowri, salutations to you Narayani.

deepMeaning.blessing: Fulfillment of all wishes and purposes
deepMeaning.protection: She is the refuge (Sharanye) for all devotees

trivia: Popular during Navaratri festival

name: Asato Ma Sadgamaya
sanskrit: Om Asato Maa Sad-Gamaya Tamaso Maa Jyotir-Gamaya Mrtyor-Maa Amrtam Gamaya Om Shaantih Shaantih Shaantih
meaning: Lead me from untruth to truth, from darkness to light, from death to immortality. Om Peace, Peace, Peace.

deepMeaning.philosophy: Summarizes all human spiritual aspirations in three lines
deepMeaning.universality: A prayer of all human beings everywhere

trivia: Also called Pavamana Mantra, found in Yajur Veda

name: Rama Taraka Mantra
sanskrit: Shree raama raama raameti Rame raame manorame Sahasra naama tattulyam Raama naama varanane
meaning: By chanting 'Rama Rama Rama', which delights the mind, is equal to chanting the thousand names of Vishnu.

deepMeaning.power: Chanting 'Rama' three times equals chanting 1000 names of Vishnu
deepMeaning.manorame: Delights the mind - brings mental peace
deepMeaning.context: Shiva told this to Parvati - he himself chants Rama's name

trivia: Shiva is said to constantly chant 'Rama'

name: Sarve Bhavantu Sukhinah
sanskrit: Om sarve bhavantu sukhinaha Sarve santu niraamayaaha Sarve bhadrani pashyantu Maa kaschiddukha bhaag Bhavet
meaning: May all be happy, may all be free from illness, may all see goodness, may none suffer from sorrow.

fourWishes.niraamayaaha: May all be free from disease

deepMeaning.universality: Not just for self or family - for ALL beings
deepMeaning.philosophy: Demonstrates the Hindu concept of universal welfare (Loka Sangraha)
deepMeaning.lesson: True spirituality includes wishing well for everyone

trivia: One of the most universal Hindu prayers

name: Tvameva Mata
sanskrit: tvameva mātā ca pitā tvameva tvameva bandhuśca sakhā tvameva tvameva vidyā draviṇaṃ tvameva tvameva sarvaṃ mama devadeva
meaning: You are my mother and father, you are my relative and friend, you are my education and wealth, you are my everything, O Lord of Lords.

deepMeaning.totalSurrender: God is everything - all relationships and possessions
deepMeaning.philosophy: When you have God, you have everything
deepMeaning.devotion: Expresses complete dependence on the divine

trivia: Can be addressed to any deity - very versatile prayer

name: Buddhir Balam (Hanuman Shloka)
sanskrit: buddhirbalaṃ yaśodhairyam nirbhayatvamarogatā ajāḍhyaṃ vākpaṭutvaṃcha hanumat smaraṇādbhavet
meaning: Intelligence, strength, fame, courage, fearlessness, good health, sharpness of wit, and speaking skills - all are obtained by remembering Hanuman.

deepMeaning.hanumanQualities: Hanuman demonstrated all these in Sundara Kanda of Ramayana
deepMeaning.practice: Simply remembering (smaranam) Hanuman gives these benefits

trivia: Hanuman is considered the 11th Rudra (form of Shiva)

name: Shantakaram (Vishnu Dhyana)
sanskrit: Shaantaa-kaaram bhujaga-shayanam padma-naabham suresham Vishwaadhaaram gagana sadrusham megha varnam shubhangam Lakshmi-Kaantam Kamala-Nayanam Yogibhir-Dhyaana-Gamyam Vande Vishnum Bhava-Bhaya-Haram Sarva-Lokaika-Naatham
meaning: I bow to Vishnu with peaceful form, sleeping on serpent, lotus-naveled, support of universe, sky-like, cloud-colored, beautiful, Lakshmi's husband, lotus-eyed, reached by yogis, remover of worldly fears, lord of all worlds.

visualDescription.padmanaabham: With lotus at navel (from which Brahma emerged)

trivia: Describes Vishnu in Anantashayana pose (sleeping on cosmic serpent)

name: Pradakshina Shloka
sanskrit: yāni kāni cha pāpāni janmāntarakṛtāni cha tāni sarvāṇi naśyanti pradakṣiṇapade pade
meaning: Whatever sins committed in this or previous births, all those are destroyed with each step of circumambulation.

deepMeaning.pradakshina: Walking clockwise around a deity, temple, or sacred object
deepMeaning.power: Each step destroys sins from current and past lives
deepMeaning.symbolism: The deity/sacred object is at the center of our life
deepMeaning.direction: Always clockwise (keeping the deity on your right)
deepMeaning.types: Can be around temple, deity, tulsi plant, or even oneself

trivia: Pradakshina means 'to the right' - clockwise direction

name: Papoham (Surrender Prayer)
sanskrit: Paapoham paapa karmaaham paapaatman paapa sambhava Anyatha sharanam naasti tvameva sharanam mama
meaning: I am sinful, my actions are sinful, my soul is sinful, born of sin. I have no other refuge, you alone are my refuge.

deepMeaning.surrender: Total surrender to the divine as the only refuge
deepMeaning.psychology: Accepting flaws is the first step to transformation
deepMeaning.universality: Can be addressed to any deity
deepMeaning.contrast: Shows the gap between human imperfection and divine perfection

trivia: Similar to the concept of confession in other religions
